entry.title: Cost Optimization for Networking
entry.content:
14 November 2024

Cost Optimization for Networking

Hosts:
Jamie and Matt

Guests:
Dave DeRicco - Sr. TAM, AWS

Abstract:
Why is my data transfer costs so high? What would be the cost if I changed from centralized to decentralized inspection. How are my charges going to look when we double or triple our traffic? If you have questions like this then tune in with Dave DeRicco, Matt and Jamie break this all down and talk about it.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Tailscale Concepts and applying them to your AWS Workloads

link.title: Tailscale Concepts and applying them to your AWS Workloads

entry.content:
7 November 2024

Tailscale Concepts and applying them to your AWS Workloads

Hosts:
Tom Adamski

Guests:
Alex Kretzschmar, DevRel Manager
Allen Vailliencourt, Partner Solutions Engineer

Abstract:
Join us for an educational dive into Tailscale's core networking concepts and discover how to effectively implement them across your AWS infrastructure. This live stream bridges the gap between Tailscale's zero-trust networking principles and practical AWS deployments, helping you build more secure and manageable cloud environments.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: New Launch: Introducing Amazon VPC security groups associations and sharing

link.title: New Launch: Introducing Amazon VPC security groups associations and sharing

entry.content:
31 October 2024

New Launch: Introducing Amazon VPC security groups associations and sharing

Hosts:
Alexandra Huides, Tom Adamski

Guests:
Abhi Maras, Sr. Product Manager, EC2 Networking

Abstract:
Join us to learn about recently launched features that simplify Security Group management. We'll cover Security Group Association, which allows you to use the same Security Group across VPCs within the same account, and Security Group Sharing, which enables cross-account sharing in a VPC sharing model
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: How to migrate to Amazon VPC Lattice and use DNS to simplify service discovery

link.title: How to migrate to Amazon VPC Lattice and use DNS to simplify service discovery

entry.content:
17 October 2024

How to migrate to Amazon VPC Lattice and use DNS to simplify service discovery

Hosts:
Alexandra Huides

Guests:
Pablo SÃ¡nchez Carmona, Sr. Solutions Architect, Networking
Scott Morrison, Sr. Solutions Architect, Networking
Maialen Loinaz Anton, Solutions Architect

Abstract:
This session is an in-depth exploration of migrating to Amazon VPC Lattice. We will whiteboard DNS migration options, do a live demo of a new automated DNS configuration solution for VPC Lattice, and answer questions. The goal is to help you understand how you can leverage VPC Lattice to simplify service discovery and ease the migration process for clients and applications.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.content:
10 October 2024

Automating Networking Monitoring and Alerting on AWS, and the AWS Solutions Library

Hosts:
Jamie and Matt

Guests:
Luis Guirigay - Head, Solutions, AWS Solutions Library, AWS
Daniel Zilberman - Sr SA, AWS Solutions Library, AWS
Zoran Pucar - Principal TAM, AWS

Abstract:
In this session, we'll dive into guidance for Automating Network Monitoring and Alerting on AWS, a must have for any network focused cloud engineer. We'll also take some time to dive into the AWS Solutions Library, and other solutions that are on offer. Bring your questions!
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Web Client JA3 fingerprinting at the edge

link.title: Web Client JA3 fingerprinting at the edge

entry.content:
3 October 2024

Web Client JA3 fingerprinting at the edge

Hosts:
Tom Adamski

Guests:
Oleksandr Golovatyi, Sr. Technical Account Manager
Maksim Akifev, Sr. Product Manager
Alex Moening, Sr. Specialist Solutions Architect

Abstract:
Gain deep visibility into client behavior and bolster protection against advanced web threats using the power of AWS WAF and AWS CloudFront. In this hands-on session, you'll learn how to precisely identify suspicious encrypted traffic and enforce granular access control policies for your API-driven workloads.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

link.title: The Routing Loop - Ask Me Anything

entry.content:
19 September 2024

The Routing Loop - Ask Me Anything

Jamie and Riggs

Guests:
All of our audience!

Join Jamie and Riggs where you ask us questions. We will answer things for any network service including Cloud Wan, TGW peering, PrivateLink, CloudFront vs Global Acclerator and of course Riggs will also talk a little on AI. Bring your questions!

entry.title: Amazon VPC Lattice - Best Practices, Migrations, and How it all Works

link.title: Amazon VPC Lattice - Best Practices, Migrations, and How it all Works

entry.content:
12 September 2024

Amazon VPC Lattice - Best Practices, Migrations, and How it all Works

Hosts:
Jamie and Matt

Guests:
Justin Davies, Principal Product Manager EC2N

Abstract:
Join Jamie and Matt as we talk to Justin Davies the Principal Product Manager of Amazon VPC Lattice. We will talk about best practices, where Lattice fits in this new crazy world of networking, and how to migrate to Lattice. We will also talk about how things work under the hood to give a better picture on what is going on with your packets! Bring your questions!
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Whats New with ELB - Config Idle Timeout feature for NLB and GWLB

link.title: Whats New with ELB - Config Idle Timeout feature for NLB and GWLB

entry.content:
5 September 2024

Whats New with ELB - Config Idle Timeout feature for NLB and GWLB

Hosts:
Jamie

Guests:
Milind Kulkarni, Principal Product Manager EC2N
Felipe de Silva, Principal Solutions Architect

Abstract:
Join Milind and Felipe to learn more about the new feature just launched on 9/4/2024 Configurable Idle Timeout on Network Load Balancer and Gateway Load Balancer. We will discuss why this is important, where this is useful and how to configure it in the console and API. We will also discuss some caveats with the service.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: AWS and Aviatrix - A chat about AWS Cloud Wan and all things cloud connectivity

link.title: AWS and Aviatrix - A chat about AWS Cloud Wan and all things cloud connectivity

entry.content:
29 August 2024

AWS and Aviatrix - A chat about AWS Cloud Wan and all things cloud connectivity

Hosts:
Jamie and Matt

Guests:
Shridhar Kulkarni, Principal Product Manager EC2N
Christopher McHenry, VP of Product at Aviatrix

Abstract:
Join us to learn more about the AWS Cloud WAN Connector in partnership with Aviatrix.

The AWS Cloud WAN Connector facilitates automatic integration of Aviatrix transit gateways with AWS Cloud WAN, allowing users to extend their AWS-centric operations to a multi-cloud strategy effortlessly.

In this session, weâll demonstrate how this solution automates the provisioning of transit gateways, the creation of network domains, and the establishment of BGP over GRE connections to Cloud WAN hubs, ensuring consistent network segmentation across environments.

By leveraging event-driven automation and running on the Aviatrix Extensibility Framework, the connector streamlines network management, reduces manual intervention, and enhances operational efficiency for organizations using AWS as their primary cloud.

Weâll also discuss how using the new CloudWAN Service Insertion integration, customers can now achieve centralized east-west and internet-egress inspection, secure multi-cloud connectivity, encrypt on-premises connectivity end-to-end, secure connectivity to AWS partitions such as AWS China and AWS GovCloud, and provide B2B connectivity with partners.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions
